{"step_by_step_thinking": "Infarction of the anterior inferior cerebellar artery (AICA) can cause damage to various structures in the brain. According to the provided documents, AICA infarction can result in symptoms such as profound deafness, transient vertigo, minimal cerebellar signs, loss of hearing, cerebellar ataxia, and facial paralysis. Based on this information, it is likely that AICA infarction can cause damage to the vestibular nuclei, which are responsible for maintaining balance and coordinating eye movements. Therefore, the answer choice is C. Vestibular nuclei.", "answer_choice": "C"}
